decision_conditions: The applicant has not submitted sufficient justification to warrant replacing Use Class E(g) with an events venue (Use Class Sui Generis) on land designated as a Strategic Industrial Location and Preferred Industrial Location. Therefore, the proposal is contrary to Policies E4 and E5 of The London Plan (2021), Policy E2 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 1 (2012), and Policy DME 1 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 2 (2020) and is unacceptable.

The applicant has not submitted adequate information to demonstrate the proposal would adhere to agent of change principles that would result in suitable internal and external environments for the proposed uses and that would not be compromise the neighbouring industrial uses. As such, the proposal would be unacceptable and contrary to Policy D13 of The London Plan (2021).

The applicant has not submitted adequate information to demonstrate that the proposal would include facilities to make the venue accessible to older and disabled people. As such, it would be unacceptable and contrary to Policy D5 of The London Plan (2021).

The applicant has not submitted adequate information to demonstrate that the proposal would provide appropriate waste storage. As such, it would be unacceptable and contrary to Policy DMHB 11 of Hillingdon Council's Local Plan Part 2 (2020).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to all relevant planning legislation, regulations, guidance, circulars and Council policies, including The Human Rights Act (1998) (HRA 1998) which makes it unlawful for the Council to act incompatibly with Convention rights, specifically Article 6 (right to a fair hearing); Article 8 (right to respect for private and family life); Article 1 of the First Protocol (protection of property) and Article 14 (prohibition of discrimination).

The decision to REFUSE planning permission has been taken having regard to the policies and proposals in the Hillingdon Local Plan Part 1 (2012) and Part 2 (2020) set out below, including Supplementary Planning Guidance, and to all relevant material considerations, including The London Plan - The Spatial Development Strategy for London consolidated with alterations since 2011 (2016) and national guidance.
description: Change of use from TV/radio station to an events venue (Use Class Sui Generis)
